newsitem.title: MEXICO: Ex-Mexican prosecutor arrested in Madrid - Notimex.
newsitem.headline: Ex-Mexican prosecutor arrested in Madrid - Notimex.

text.p: The former prosecutor who jailed the brother of ex-President Carlos Salinas on murder charges was arrested in Madrid on Friday, state news agency Notimex reported.
Pablo Chapa Bezanilla turned fugitive after Mexican authorities accused him of evidence-rigging and body-snatching while special prosecutor in the Attorney General's Office.

The charges against him arose in March from the discovery of a skeleton in late 1996 at the Mexico City ranch of Raul Salinas, brother to the ex-president, whom Chapa arrested in February 1995 on charges of masterminding the murder of Jose Francisco Ruiz Massieu, secretary general of the ruling Institutional Revolutionary Party.
Chapa led the public to believe that the body was that of a missing congressmen who was wanted on charges of helping Raul Salinas plan the killing.
Investigators, however, found the body was that of the relative of a witch who was helping Chapa with the investigation.
Authorities claimed it was dug up from a cemetery and planted at the Salinas ranch.
Chapa was fired from the attorney general's office in December 1996 and has been in hiding since February.
